commands.name: render
commands.description: Render files or projects to various document types.

options.name: output
options.description: Write output to FILE (use '--output -' for stdout).

options.name: output-dir
options.description: Write output to DIR (path is input/project relative)

options.name: site-url
options.description: Override site-url for website or book output

options.name: execute-daemon
options.description: Keep Jupyter kernel alive (defaults to 300 seconds).

options.name: execute-daemon-restart
options.description: Restart keepalive Jupyter kernel before render.

options.name: execute-debug
options.description: Show debug output when executing computations.

options.name: use-freezer
options.description: Force use of frozen computations for an incremental file render.

options.name: cache
options.description: Cache execution output (--no-cache to prevent cache).

options.name: no-clean
options.description: Do not clean project output-dir prior to render

options.name: debug
options.description: Leave intermediate files in place after render.

options.name: log-level
options.description: Log level (debug, info, warning, error, critical)

examples.name: Render Markdown
examples.description:
quarto render document.qmd
quarto render document.qmd --to html
quarto render document.qmd --to pdf --toc

examples.name: Render Notebook
examples.description:
quarto render notebook.ipynb
quarto render notebook.ipynb --to docx
quarto render notebook.ipynb --to pdf --toc

examples.name: Render w/ Metadata
examples.description:
quarto render document.qmd -M echo:false
quarto render document.qmd -M code-fold:true

commands.name: help
commands.description: Show this help or the help of a sub-command.

commands.name: preview
commands.description:
Render and preview a document or website project.

Automatically reloads the browser when input files or document resources (e.g. CSS) change.

For website preview, the most recent execution results of computational documents are used to render
the site (this is to optimize startup time). If you want to perform a full render prior to
previewing pass the --render option with "all" or a comma-separated list of formats to render.

For document preview, input file changes will result in a re-render (pass --no-watch to prevent).

You can also include arbitrary command line arguments to be forwarded to [1mquarto render[22m.

options.name: port
options.description:
Suggested port to listen on (defaults to random value between 3000 and 8000).
If the port is not available then a random port between 3000 and 8000 will be selected.

options.name: render
options.description: Render to the specified format(s) before previewing

options.name: no-serve
options.description: Don't run a local preview web server (just monitor and re-render input files)

options.name: no-navigate
options.description: Don't navigate the browser automatically when outputs are updated.

options.name: no-browser
options.description: Don't open a browser to preview the site.

options.name: no-watch-inputs
options.description: Do not re-render input files when they change.

options.name: timeout
options.description: Time (in seconds) after which to exit if there are no active clients.

options.name: log-level
options.description: Log level (debug, info, warning, error, critical)

examples.name: Preview document with render command line args
Preview document (don't watch for input changes)
Preview website with most recent execution results
Previewing website using a specific port
Fully render all website/book formats then preview
Fully render the html format then preview

commands.name: serve
commands.description:
Serve a Shiny interactive document.

By default, the document will be rendered first and then served. If you have previously rendered the document, pass --no-render to skip the rendering step.

options.name: no-render
options.description: Do not render the document before serving.

options.name: port
options.description: The TCP port that the application should listen on.

options.name: browser
options.description: Open a browser to preview the site.

options.name: log-level
options.description: Log level (debug, info, warning, error, critical)

commands.name: help
commands.description: Show this help or the help of a sub-command.

commands.name: publish
commands.description:
Publish a document or project to a provider.

Available providers include:

 - Quarto Pub (quarto-pub)
 - GitHub Pages (gh-pages)
 - Posit Connect (connect)
 - Posit Connect Cloud (posit-connect-cloud)
 - Netlify (netlify)
 - Confluence (confluence)
 - Hugging Face Spaces (huggingface)

Accounts are configured interactively during publishing.
Manage/remove accounts with: quarto publish accounts

options.name: no-prompt
options.description: Do not prompt to confirm publishing destination

options.name: no-browser
options.description: Do not open a browser to the site after publishing

options.name: log-level
options.description: Log level (debug, info, warning, error, critical)

examples.name: Publish project to Hugging Face Spaces
Publish project to Posit Connect Cloud

commands.name: inspect
commands.description:
Inspect a Quarto project or input path.

Inspecting a project returns its config and engines.
Inspecting an input path return its formats, engine, and dependent resources.

Emits results of inspection as JSON to output (or stdout if not provided).

options.name: log-level
options.description: Log level (debug, info, warning, error, critical)

commands.name: build-ts-extension
commands.description:
Build TypeScript execution engine extensions.

This command type-checks and bundles TypeScript extensions into single JavaScript files using Quarto's bundled deno bundle.

The entry point is determined by:
  1. [entry-point] command-line argument (if specified)
  2. bundle.entryPoint in deno.json (if specified)
  3. Single .ts file in src/ directory
  4. src/mod.ts (if multiple .ts files exist)

options.name: init-config
options.description: Generate deno.json with absolute importMap path

options.name: log-level
options.description: Log level (debug, info, warning, error, critical)

commands.name: help
commands.description: Show this help or the help of a sub-command.

commands.name: typst-gather
commands.description:
Gather Typst packages for a format extension.

This command scans Typst files for @preview imports and downloads the packages to a local directory for offline use.

Configuration is determined by:
  1. typst-gather.toml in current directory (if present)
  2. Auto-detection from _extension.yml (template and template-partials)

options.name: init-config
options.description: Generate a starter typst-gather.toml in current directory

options.name: log-level
options.description: Log level (debug, info, warning, error, critical)
